intro: Talauma arcabucoana, commonly known as the Andean tree fern, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in cloud forests. Its rhizome system helps it anchor firmly in rocky or soil substrates. The fronds are used in traditional medicine by local communities for their purported healing properties.
